subject: Philosophy
title: No-Self (Anatta)
description: A short lesson to help you apply No-Self (Anatta).

hook.text: You think there's a fixed 'you' inside your body. Buddhism says look closer â€” there's nothing there.

buildup.text: Anatta means 'no-self.' There is no permanent, unchanging soul or identity within you.

discovery.text: You are a river â€” constantly flowing, changing. The 'you' of yesterday is not the 'you' of today.

twist.text: This terrifies Western thinkers raised on the idea of a soul. But the Buddha found it liberating.

climax.text: If there's no fixed self to protect, jealousy, ego, and attachment lose their grip.

punchline.text: Let go of the self and freedom follows.

quiz.question: What does 'anatta' mean in Buddhism?
options: There is no permanent, unchanging self
